cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 395 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the central Gulf, forecast to approach southeastern Louisiana Monday then bend west while weakening inland
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near Morgan City–Mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Sabine Pass TX eastward to Morgan City LA; additional TS watch east of MS-AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to Mouth of Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS; Tropical Storm Warning Pearl River mouth to MS/AL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and northern Gulf Coast from the TX/LA border eastward to the AL/FL border
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts approaching tropical-storm force possible Monday night into Tuesday (generally below 40 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge around 1 ft possible, but significant inundation (>3 ft) is not anticipated.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain Monday–Tuesday totaling 1–2 in, isolated 3 in, may cause brief ponding on terminals.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and dangerous rip-current conditions across the near-shore approaches; slight tornado risk remains east of the port.
